name: Resource-Constrained Project Scheduling - CR2
content: Certain precedence relations now carry a maximum allowed delay. For each specified constrained precedence (i, j), the successor activity j must start no later than a given maximum delay after activity i finishes. All original precedence and resource-capacity constraints remain in force, and the objective remains to minimize project completion time.
value_info: `horizon`: Integer upper bound on the scheduling time range.
`capacities`: List[int], where capacities[r] is the capacity of resource r.
`jobs`: List where each job is `[duration, successors, demands]`.
`max_delays`: List of triplets `[pred, succ, max_delay]`, meaning activity `succ` must start at most `max_delay` time units after `pred` finishes.

var1.descr: `start_times`: List[int] of length n_jobs, where start_times[i] is the start time of activity i.
